reviews.review:
An excellent first-person shooter in its own right, but with the addition of Episode 3, its true genius shines as an interactive Waiting simulator.

It's like being in line for the most amazing rollercoaster of all time - that never moves.
Best FPS ever. Period.

Half-Life 2 is a decent first person shooter, but suffers from problems with its predecessor of being too long and often-times too easy. There's a few excellent portions you don't want to miss out on, and the story has room for being dynamic and expanded upon, but it requires Episode 1 and 2 to really have substance. The main problem is that the gravity gun gimmick becomes old quite fast, and there's a large amount of vehicle-based sections. If you like Valve, you definitely have to play Half-Life 2, as it's one of their predominant games.
A must have instant FPS classic.

The best first-person shooter ever made. There are two moments in this game that stand out - the horrible realization that those giant things you've been hiding from have to die, and that first moment you use the gravity gun after [REDACTED] happens. I dare you not to cheer and laugh evilly when this happens.

Lo que realmente hace de "Half Life 2" un videojuego mÃ¡gico es el desarrollo de la trama. Meternos de nuevo en la piel de Gordon y sumergirnos en el mundo creado por Valve, es toda una delicia. La historia es tan apasionante y sorprendente, que apenas nos costarÃ¡ emocionarnos con ella. Es imposible describir con palabras todas las sensaciones que puede ofrecer, o la de giros que da el trepidante argumento. Y eso no es todo; las temÃ¡ticas de los diferentes capÃ­tulos son tan variadas que todo el mundo quedarÃ¡ contento: desde una ciudad destruida y corrompida por el poder hasta un complejo futurista digno de la mejor pelÃ­cula de ciencia ficciÃ³n, pasando por un apocalipsis zombie, por poner algunos ejemplos.
